snippet: Wen Jiabao, in a break from the past, sent signals reaffirming the party’s heavy-handed approach to the nation’s political and economic affairs.
abstract: Wen Jiabao, in his final address as China’s prime minister, warns of growing divisions between rich and poor, hazards of unchecked environmental degradation and risks posed by unbalanced economic growth; Wen also, in break from past, refrains from mentions of rampant corruption in Communist Party.

byline.original: By ANDREW JACOBS and CHRIS BUCKLEY

lead_paragraph: Wen Jiabao, in a break from the past, sent signals reaffirming the party’s heavy-handed approach to the nation’s political and economic affairs.

headline.seo: China’s Wen Gives Final Speech as Prime Minister
headline.main: Chinese Premier’s Parting Words Include Warning
headline.print_headline: Chinese Premier’s Parting Words Include Warning
